caption:
This photograph depicts a group of four young boys in an outdoor, grassy area, seemingly engaged in playful activities. The mood is lively and playful, captured in a candid manner.

In the foreground, one boy is seen from the back. He is shirtless and wearing light-colored pants. To his right, three other boys are facing the camera. The first boy in the group is holding a baseball bat, shirtless, and sporting a broad smile. Next to him is a boy wearing a red bandana on his head, also shirtless and grinning. The third boy in this group stands out with his Afro hairstyle and is wearing a patterned shirt with sleeves rolled up to the elbows and beige-colored pants.

The setting includes a lawn area with a road and blurred cars in the background, suggesting this might be in a suburban neighborhood. The lighting seems to be of a late afternoon or early evening, creating a soft and slightly dim ambiance. The image captures a moment of youth, camaraderie, and casual recreation, typical of a warm day.
title: Puerto rican boys playing softball in Brooklyn's hiland park in New York city.  The inner city today is an absolute contradiction to the main stream america of gas stations, expressways, shopping centers and tract homes.  It is populated by blacks, latins and the white poor.  Most of all, the inner city environment is human beings as beautiful and threatened as the 19th century buildings they inhabit
